title: Topic 001 Question 001
body: A company has an infernal web application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer. The instances run in an Amazon EC2 Auto
Scaling group in a single Availability Zone. A SysOps administrator must make the application highly available.
Which action should the SysOps administrator take to meet this requirement?
options: Increase the maximum number of instances in the Auto Scaling group to meet the capacity that is required at peak usage.
Increase the minimum number of instances in the Auto Scaling group to meet the capacity that is required at peak usage.
Update the Auto Scaling group to launch new instances in a second Availability Zone in the same AWS Region.
Update the Auto Scaling group to launch new instances in an Availability Zone in a second AWS Region.
